rows.title: Your song

transcript.eng:
Here is something fun to help you let go of stress:‚ÄØ  

Choose a song that reflects what you need in this moment. Do you need a gentle song to soothe your tired soul or an upbeat song to help you shake some stress out?‚ÄØ  

Make a space and move your body to the music. Remember to breathe while you move. Let your breath and the movement go together.‚ÄØ

Even a few minutes of movement can be enough to release stress and lift your mood!

rows.transcript:
Here is something fun to help you let go of stress:‚ÄØ  

Choose a song that reflects what you need in this moment. Do you need a gentle song to soothe your tired soul or an upbeat song to help you shake some stress out?‚ÄØ  

Make a space and move your body to the music. Remember to breathe while you move. Let your breath and the movement go together.‚ÄØ

Even a few minutes of movement can be enough to release stress and lift your mood!

text_1.eng: Recognising how you feel helps you care for yourself well. You deserve it.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Wonderful, I am so happy! Keep up the good work.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Sorry that things are difficult. All families struggle. @global.app_name is here to help!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Whatever went ‚Äòwrong‚Äô today, let it go and try again tomorrow. It is okay!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about giving positive instructions!

Telling our teens what we DO want them to do works better than telling them to STOP doing something.

media_title.eng: Giving positive instructions really works! Tap play to learn more

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings, greetings everyone.

Today our topic is positive instructions.

It is important to give positive instructions to our children, because when we give them positive instructions they know and understand what we are expecting them to do and they do it the way we want them to do it.

So, at the end it keeps everyone happy.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today's topic is about giving positive instructions!

Telling our teens what we DO want them to do works better than telling them to STOP doing something.
rows.media_title: Giving positive instructions really works! Tap play to learn more
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, greetings everyone.

Today our topic is positive instructions.

It is important to give positive instructions to our children, because when we give them positive instructions they know and understand what we are expecting them to do and they do it the way we want them to do it.

So, at the end it keeps everyone happy.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
When you give positive instructions, your teen is more likely to listen! 

And remember to praise your teen for any good behaviour ‚Äî the big and small things.

media_title.eng: Tap play to hear how positive instructions worked for @data.characters.media_female_3.name and her teens

media_transcript.eng:
Before, I used to raise my teens the way I was raised: I would tell them ‚Äúdon‚Äôt do this, don‚Äôt do that.‚Äù We used to fight a lot, but things have really changed when I learnt about giving positive instructions.

Now I focus on the behaviour I want to see, and give clear and simple instructions to my teens. It took time to learn to say ‚Äúplease do this‚Äù instead of ‚Äúdon‚Äôt do this.‚Äù

My teens and even my husband tell me that they love this way of doing things, because now they know what needs to be done. My teen said one day ‚ÄúI really love this new mom,‚Äù and my own stress levels have come down a lot.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
When you give positive instructions, your teen is more likely to listen! 

And remember to praise your teen for any good behaviour ‚Äî the big and small things.

rows.media_transcript:
Before, I used to raise my teens the way I was raised: I would tell them ‚Äúdon‚Äôt do this, don‚Äôt do that.‚Äù We used to fight a lot, but things have really changed when I learnt about giving positive instructions.

Now I focus on the behaviour I want to see, and give clear and simple instructions to my teens. It took time to learn to say ‚Äúplease do this‚Äù instead of ‚Äúdon‚Äôt do this.‚Äù

My teens and even my husband tell me that they love this way of doing things, because now they know what needs to be done. My teen said one day ‚ÄúI really love this new mom,‚Äù and my own stress levels have come down a lot.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Let‚Äôs do a thought experiment!

DO NOT THINK ABOUT AN ELEPHANT.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Let‚Äôs do a thought experiment!

DO NOT THINK ABOUT AN ELEPHANT.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
What are you thinking about? 

You probably DID think about an elephant...

text_2.eng:
In the same way, when we tell our teens ‚Äúdon‚Äôt do that,‚Äù they often focus only on the thing we told them not to do.
They may not understand what we *DO* want.

And like most of us, they don‚Äôt enjoy being told what not to do.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
What are you thinking about? 

You probably DID think about an elephant...
rows.text_2:
In the same way, when we tell our teens ‚Äúdon‚Äôt do that,‚Äù they often focus only on the thing we told them not to do.
They may not understand what we *DO* want.

And like most of us, they don‚Äôt enjoy being told what not to do.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
NOW, THINK ABOUT A CHEETAH!

What are you thinking about?

rows.text_1_facilitator:
NOW, THINK ABOUT A CHEETAH!

What are you thinking about?

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That‚Äôs right! Positive, clear instructions help teens focus on what they should be doing.

Teens will also feel more respected this way and are more likely to listen.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
That‚Äôs right! Positive, clear instructions help teens focus on what they should be doing.

Teens will also feel more respected this way and are more likely to listen.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let‚Äôs see what happens if @data.characters.f1_father.name tells @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name "DON'T":

character_1_text.eng: Stop kicking that ball around. Can‚Äôt you see we are busy here? You‚Äôll knock over the pot!

character_2_text.eng: But I need to practise for the match on Saturday. You never let me do anything.

character_3_text.eng: Don't you talk back to me!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: It's possible! How is she meant to practise? What should she do?

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: Tell @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name what he wants her to do

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: That's right! This would help @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name understand how to behave next time.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are some tips to help you give your teen clear and positive instructions!

section_1_text.eng: Can your teen actually do what you are about to ask? It may be impossible for them to read quietly all day, but half an hour when you really need it is realistic.

section_2_text.eng: Smile, look them in the eye and use positive words. Praise them as soon as they start to do what you ask!

section_3_text.eng: Often we know what we want in our head, but we don‚Äôt say it clearly enough. Say exactly what you want your teen to do. Try ‚Äòplease come home by 7pm‚Äô instead of ‚Äòcome home on time‚Äô.

rows.section_2_text: Smile, look them in the eye and use positive words. Praise them as soon as they start to do what you ask!
rows.section_3_text: Often we know what we want in our head, but we don‚Äôt say it clearly enough. Say exactly what you want your teen to do. Try ‚Äòplease come home by 7pm‚Äô instead of ‚Äòcome home on time‚Äô.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Let‚Äôs practise together!

Here are some common instructions parents give.
Tap each one to see a positive way of saying it.

quiz_1_question.eng: Turn each of these instructions into positive ones:

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: üëï Stop leaving your dirty clothes all over the place!

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: You could say: "I know you‚Äôve had a long day. Could you please put your clothes in the basket so it‚Äôs easier to keep things tidy? Thanks ‚Äì it really helps."

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: üéµ Stop playing your music so loud in the house!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: You could say: "That‚Äôs great music. Who is the singer? Please turn the music off when you come into the house. You can play it in your room quietly if you want. Thank you!"

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: üì± Stop playing on your phone at the dinner table!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: You could say: "I like that you enjoy your phone. Can you put it away during dinner so we can spend time together? Thanks ‚Äì I really appreciate it."

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Let‚Äôs practise together!

Here are some common instructions parents give.
Tap each one to see a positive way of saying it.

text_1_facilitator.eng: This week's home activity is to give your teen positive instructions.

text_2.eng: Remember, teenagers are much more likely to listen when we give positive, clear and realistic instructions.

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you give your teen positive instructions this week?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That's great! Well done for trying. You will see the difference it makes.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: You can do it! Notice when you normally say ‚Äòdon‚Äôt do this!‚Äô and think of a positive way to phrase it. You can try it out and see what happens.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That's okay. It can be hard to try something new. Could you think of one situation where you often tell your teen ‚Äòdon‚Äôt do this‚Äô? Try to find a positive way to give that instruction.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: That's great! Well done for trying. You will see the difference it makes.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: You can do it! Notice when you normally say ‚Äòdon‚Äôt do this!‚Äô and think of a positive way to phrase it. You can try it out and see what happens.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: That's okay. It can be hard to try something new. Could you think of one situation where you often tell your teen ‚Äòdon‚Äôt do this‚Äô? Try to find a positive way to give that instruction.
rows.quiz_1_question: Can you give your teen positive instructions this week?
rows.text_1_facilitator: This week's home activity is to give your teen positive instructions.
rows.text_2: Remember, teenagers are much more likely to listen when we give positive, clear and realistic instructions.

text_1_facilitator.eng: More positive instructions means less frustrations. And that is something we all want, right?

media_title.eng: Hear how positive instructions helped @data.characters.media_daughter_3.name and her mother

media_transcript.eng:
At first, I did not care much that my mother was doing with @global.app_name. But then I started to see my mother change how she communicated with us.

One day, when I was going out with my friends, she said I must be home by 6pm. I was like ‚ÄúHmmm okay,‚Äù because she normally did not give clear instructions on what she wanted ‚Äì she would just say nothing and then shout at me for being late when I got home.

When I got home around 5pm, my mother gave me a hug and said ‚ÄúThank you for being on time.‚Äù It was strange, but I liked it.

Since then, we have much clearer communication in the house.

rows.text_1_facilitator: More positive instructions means less frustrations. And that is something we all want, right?
rows.media_title: Hear how positive instructions helped @data.characters.media_daughter_3.name and her mother
rows.media_transcript:
At first, I did not care much that my mother was doing with @global.app_name. But then I started to see my mother change how she communicated with us.

One day, when I was going out with my friends, she said I must be home by 6pm. I was like ‚ÄúHmmm okay,‚Äù because she normally did not give clear instructions on what she wanted ‚Äì she would just say nothing and then shout at me for being late when I got home.

When I got home around 5pm, my mother gave me a hug and said ‚ÄúThank you for being on time.‚Äù It was strange, but I liked it.

Since then, we have much clearer communication in the house.
